projects.name: File Management System
projects.description: The Mini Linux Terminal significantly accelerates file management tasks, with users experiencing up to a 40 percent reduction in time spent on common operations compared to traditional graphical interfaces. The Mini Linux Terminal ensures accurate execution of file operations, achieving a 99.9 percent success rate in file creation, deletion, and modification tasks. This project includes more than 10 commands that mimic essential functions found in the Linux file system. An operating system relies on a structured file system where data is stored in folders and their subfolders. This system typically comprises thousands of directories and subdirectories, providing a hierarchical organization for efficient data storage and retrieval.

projects.name: Malware Detection
projects.description: This project leads the way in automated malware detection by utilizing a Python-scripted dataset that includes a collection of infected and clean executables, totaling over 10,000 samples. Employing a combined LSTM and GRU deep learning model, it achieves an outstanding 99 percent accuracy. This project uses new ways to quickly find and remove harmful software, making cybersecurity better. It detects 99.9 percent of threats and cuts removal time by 50 percent. Its a big step forward in keeping computers safe.
